snippet: The European Court of Human Rights ruled Tuesday that Italy’s prisons violated inmates’ basic rights and fined the government $130,000. It also ordered Italy to make improvements within a year.
abstract: European Court of Human Rights rules that Italy's prisons violate inmates' basic rights and fines government $130,000; ruling relates to 2009 case brought by seven inmates.
lead_paragraph: The European Court of Human Rights ruled Tuesday that Italy’s prisons violated inmates’ basic rights and fined the government $130,000. It also ordered Italy to make improvements within a year.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
